result.markdown:
---
title: "Solutions 5"
editor_options: 
  chunk_output_type: console
---

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code  code-summary="Set up"}
library(tidyverse)
library(gssr)
library(marginaleffects)
library(broom)

gss2022 <- gss_get_yr(2022)
```
:::


## Linear Regression

*We will use this data.*


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dols <- gss2022 |> 
  select(tvhours, degree, madeg, padeg) |> 
  mutate(pardeg = pmax(madeg, padeg, na.rm = TRUE),
         college = if_else(degree >= 3, 1L, 0L),
         parcol = if_else(pardeg >= 3, 1L, 0L)) |>
  select(tvhours, college, parcol) |> 
  drop_na()
```
:::


### Exercise

**Additive link function, no interactions**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mod1 <- glm(tvhours ~ college + parcol, data = dols)

# ATE estimate
avg_slopes(mod1, variables = "college") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 9
  term  contrast estimate std.error statistic p.value s.value conf.low conf.high
  <chr> <chr>       <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
1 coll… 1 - 0      -0.796     0.151     -5.27 1.35e-7    22.8    -1.09    -0.500
```


:::
:::


**Answer (using base R):**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
p0 <- predict(mod1, newdata = dols |> mutate(college = 0))
p1 <- predict(mod1, newdata = dols |> mutate(college = 1))

mean(p1 - p0)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] -0.7957246
```


:::
:::


ATT/ATU estimate


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_slopes(
  model = mod1, 
  variables = "college",
  by = "college" # separately by treatment group
) |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 13
  term    contrast college estimate std.error statistic p.value s.value conf.low
  <chr>   <chr>      <int>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
1 college mean(1)…       0   -0.796     0.151     -5.27 1.35e-7    22.8    -1.09
2 college mean(1)…       1   -0.796     0.151     -5.27 1.35e-7    22.8    -1.09
# ℹ 4 more variables: conf.high <dbl>, predicted_lo <dbl>, predicted_hi <dbl>,
#   predicted <dbl>
```


:::
:::


**Answer (using using base R):**

*Note. You should be able to know that the answer will be exactly the same because of the model being used.*


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dols$p0 <- predict(mod1, newdata = dols |> mutate(college = 0))
dols$p1 <- predict(mod1, newdata = dols |> mutate(college = 1))

dols |> 
  mutate(estimate = p1 - p0) |> 
  group_by(college) |> 
  summarize(estimate = mean(estimate))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  college estimate
    <int>    <dbl>
1       0   -0.796
2       1   -0.796
```


:::
:::


### Exercise

**Additive link function, with interactions**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mod2 <- lm(tvhours ~ college * parcol, data = dols)

# ATE estimate
avg_slopes(mod2, variables = "college") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 9
  term  contrast estimate std.error statistic p.value s.value conf.low conf.high
  <chr> <chr>       <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
1 coll… 1 - 0      -0.803     0.152     -5.29 1.20e-7    23.0    -1.10    -0.506
```


:::
:::


**Answer (using matrix algebra):**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
beta <- coefficients(mod2) |> as.matrix(ncol = 1) ## ensures this is a column vector

M0 <- model.matrix(tvhours ~ college * parcol, data = dols |> mutate(college = 0))
pred0 <- M0 %*% beta

M1 <- model.matrix(tvhours ~ college * parcol, data = dols |> mutate(college = 1))
pred1 <- M1 %*% beta

mean(pred1 - pred0)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] -0.8033206
```


:::
:::


ATT/ATU estimate


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_slopes(
  model = mod2, 
  variables = "college",
  by = "college" # separately by treatment group
) |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 13
  term    contrast college estimate std.error statistic p.value s.value conf.low
  <chr>   <chr>      <int>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
1 college mean(1)…       0   -0.821     0.160     -5.14 2.70e-7    21.8    -1.13
2 college mean(1)…       1   -0.772     0.159     -4.87 1.13e-6    19.8    -1.08
# ℹ 4 more variables: conf.high <dbl>, predicted_lo <dbl>, predicted_hi <dbl>,
#   predicted <dbl>
```


:::
:::


**Answer (using previous calculations)**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dols$p1 <- pred1
dols$p0 <- pred0

dols |> 
  group_by(college) |> 
  summarize(estimate = mean(p1 - p0))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  college estimate
    <int>    <dbl>
1       0   -0.821
2       1   -0.772
```


:::
:::


## Poisson Regression

*We will use this data.*


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dqp <- gss2022 |>
  filter(wrkstat == 1) |> # full time workers
  select(realrinc, degree, madeg, padeg, sex, age) |> 
  mutate(pardeg = pmax(madeg, padeg, na.rm = TRUE),
         college = if_else(degree >= 3, 1L, 0L),
         parcol = if_else(pardeg >= 3, 1L, 0L),
         female = if_else(sex == 2, 1L, 0L),
         realrinc = floor(realrinc)) |>             # integer
  select(realrinc, college, parcol, female, age) |> 
  drop_na()
```
:::


### Exercise

**Using the log-counts, no interactions**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
qp1 <- glm(realrinc ~ college + (parcol + female + age + I(age^2)), 
           data = dqp,
           family = "quasipoisson")

avg_slopes(qp1,
           variables = "college",
           type = "link") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 9
  term    contrast estimate std.error statistic  p.value s.value conf.low
  <chr>   <chr>       <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
1 college 1 - 0       0.599    0.0510      11.7 7.45e-32    103.    0.499
# ℹ 1 more variable: conf.high <dbl>
```


:::
:::


**Answer:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
pred0 <- predict(qp1, newdata = mutate(dqp, college = 0), type = "link")
pred1 <- predict(qp1, newdata = mutate(dqp, college = 1), type = "link")

mean(pred1 - pred0)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
[1] 0.5994521
```


:::
:::


ATU/ATT


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_slopes(qp1,
           variables = "college",
           type = "link",
           by = "college") |> # separately by treatment group
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 13
  term   contrast college estimate std.error statistic  p.value s.value conf.low
  <chr>  <chr>      <int>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
1 colle… mean(1)…       0    0.599    0.0510      11.7 7.45e-32    103.    0.499
2 colle… mean(1)…       1    0.599    0.0510      11.7 7.45e-32    103.    0.499
# ℹ 4 more variables: conf.high <dbl>, predicted_lo <dbl>, predicted_hi <dbl>,
#   predicted <dbl>
```


:::
:::


**Answer**:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dqp$pred0 <- pred0
dqp$pred1 <- pred1

dqp |> 
  group_by(college) |> 
  summarize(estimate = mean(pred1 - pred0))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  college estimate
    <int>    <dbl>
1       0    0.599
2       1    0.599
```


:::
:::


### Exercise

**Non-linear response, no interactions**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_slopes(qp1,
           variables = "college",
           type = "response") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 9
  term    contrast estimate std.error statistic  p.value s.value conf.low
  <chr>   <chr>       <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
1 college 1 - 0      21237.     1831.      11.6 4.18e-31    101.   17649.
# ℹ 1 more variable: conf.high <dbl>
```


:::
:::


**Answer:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
## use appropriate link function for Poisson
dqp$pred0 <- exp(pred0)
dqp$pred1 <- exp(pred1)

dqp |> 
  summarize(ate = mean(pred1 - pred0))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 1
     ate
   <dbl>
1 21237.
```


:::
:::


ATT/ ATU


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_slopes(qp1,
           variables = "college",
           type = "response",
           by = "college") |> # separately by treatment group
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 13
  term   contrast college estimate std.error statistic  p.value s.value conf.low
  <chr>  <chr>      <int>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
1 colle… mean(1)…       0   20636.     1861.      11.1 1.41e-28    92.5   16988.
2 colle… mean(1)…       1   21977.     1816.      12.1 1.05e-33   110.    18417.
# ℹ 4 more variables: conf.high <dbl>, predicted_lo <dbl>, predicted_hi <dbl>,
#   predicted <dbl>
```


:::
:::


**Answer:**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dqp |> 
  group_by(college) |> 
  summarize(ate = mean(pred1 - pred0))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  college    ate
    <int>  <dbl>
1       0 20636.
2       1 21977.
```


:::
:::


### Exercise

**Using the log-counts, with interactions**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
qp2 <- glm(realrinc ~ college * (parcol + female + age + I(age^2)), 
           data = dqp,
           family = "quasipoisson")

avg_slopes(qp2,
           variables = "college",
           type = "link") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 9
```

```{.r .cell-code}
dqp |>
```

### Exercise

**Non-linear response, with interactions**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_slopes(qp2,
           variables = "college",
           type = "response") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

## Logistic Regression

*We will use this data.*


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dlr <- gss2022 |>
  select(abany, degree, madeg, padeg, sex, age) |> 
  mutate(pardeg = pmax(madeg, padeg, na.rm = TRUE),
         college = if_else(degree >= 3, 1L, 0L),
         parcol = if_else(pardeg >= 3, 1L, 0L),
         female = if_else(sex == 2, 1L, 0L),
         abany = if_else(abany == 1, 1L, 0L)) |>
  select(abany, college, parcol, female, age) |> 
  drop_na()
```
:::


### Exercise

**Using log-odds, no interactions**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lr1 <- glm(abany ~ college + (parcol + female + age + I(age^2)),
          data = dlr,
          family = binomial)

# ATE estimate
avg_slopes(lr1,
           variables = "college",
           type = "link") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 9
  term  contrast estimate std.error statistic p.value s.value conf.low conf.high
  <chr> <chr>       <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
1 coll… 1 - 0       0.438     0.146      3.00 0.00273    8.52    0.151     0.724
```


:::
:::


Answer:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dlr$pred0 <- predict(lr1, newdata = dlr |> mutate(college = 0), type = "link")
dlr$pred1 <- predict(lr1, newdata = dlr |> mutate(college = 1), type = "link")

dlr |> 
  summarize(estimate = mean(pred1 - pred0))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 1
  estimate
     <dbl>
1    0.438
```


:::
:::


ATT/ATU


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_slopes(lr1,
           variables = "college",
           by = "college",
           type = "link") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 13
  term    contrast college estimate std.error statistic p.value s.value conf.low
  <chr>   <chr>      <int>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
1 college mean(1)…       0    0.438     0.146      3.00 0.00273    8.52    0.151
2 college mean(1)…       1    0.438     0.146      3.00 0.00273    8.52    0.151
# ℹ 4 more variables: conf.high <dbl>, predicted_lo <dbl>, predicted_hi <dbl>,
#   predicted <dbl>
```


:::
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dlr |> 
  group_by(college) |> 
  summarize(estimate = mean(pred1 - pred0))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 2
  college estimate
    <int>    <dbl>
1       0    0.438
2       1    0.438
```


:::
:::


### Exercise

**Using non-linear response (aka probabilities), no interactions**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
# ATE estimate
avg_slopes(lr1,
           variables = "college",
           type = "response") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 9
  term  contrast estimate std.error statistic p.value s.value conf.low conf.high
  <chr> <chr>       <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>     <dbl>
1 coll… 1 - 0       0.102    0.0337      3.02 0.00249    8.65   0.0359     0.168
```


:::
:::


Answer:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dlr |> 
  mutate(across(starts_with("pred"), plogis)) |> 
  summarize(estimate = mean(pred1 - pred0))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 1 × 1
  estimate
     <dbl>
1    0.102
```


:::
:::


ATT/ATU


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_slopes(lr1,
           variables = "college",
           by = "college",
           type = "response") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 13
  term    contrast college estimate std.error statistic p.value s.value conf.low
  <chr>   <chr>      <int>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>

```

```{.r .cell-code}
dlr |> 
  mutate(across(starts_with("pred"), plogis)) |> 
  group_by(college) |> 
  summarize(estimate = mean(pred1 - pred0))
```

### Exercise

**Using log-odds, with interactions**


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
lr2 <- glm(abany ~ college * (parcol + female + age + I(age^2)),
          data = dlr,
          family = binomial)

# ATE estimate
avg_slopes(lr2,
           variables = "college",
           type = "link") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

```

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dlr$pred1 <- predict(lr2, newdata = dlr |> mutate(college = 1), type = "link")

dlr |>
```

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_slopes(lr2,
           variables = "college",
           by = "college",
           type = "link") |> 
  tidy()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 2 × 13
  term    contrast college estimate std.error statistic p.value s.value conf.low
  <chr>   <chr>      <int>    <dbl>     <dbl>     <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>    <dbl>
1 college mean(1)…       0    0.450     0.159      2.83 0.00460    7.76    0.139
2 college mean(1)…       1    0.458     0.161      2.85 0.00435    7.84    0.143
# ℹ 4 more variables: conf.high <dbl>, predicted_lo <dbl>, predicted_hi <dbl>,
#   predicted <dbl>
```


:::
:::


Answer:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
dlr |> 
  group_by(college) |> 
  summarize(estimate = mean(pred1 - pred0))
```

```
# A tibble: 2 × 2

    <int>    <dbl>
1       0    0.450
2       1    0.458
```

## Standard Errors

So far, we haven't calculated the standard errors at all. And yet `marginaleffects` does this seamlessly.

Here is a potential bootstrap implementation. To make things easier, I will wrap up the calculation of the ATE in a function.

*Note. This code is inefficient and will only work with "glm" objects.*


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
bootstrap_ate <- function(obj, variable, type = c("link", "response"), S = 1e3) {
  
  type <- match.arg(type)
  data <- obj$data
  data0 <- mutate(data, {{variable}} := 0)
  data1 <- mutate(data, {{variable}} := 1)
  
  replicate(S, {
    i <- sample(nrow(data), replace = TRUE)
    nobj <- glm(obj$formula, data = data[i, ], family = obj$family)
    pred0 <- predict(nobj, newdata = data0[i, ], type = type)
    pred1 <- predict(nobj, newdata = data1[i, ], type = type)
    mean(pred1 - pred0)
  })
}
```
:::


Logistic Regression using link function:


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
avg_slopes(lr2, variables = "college", type = "link")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```

    Term Contrast Estimate Std. Error    z Pr(>|z|)   S 2.5 % 97.5 %
 college    1 - 0    0.453      0.149 3.04  0.00239 8.7 0.161  0.745

Columns: term, contrast, estimate, std.error, statistic, p.value, s.value, conf.low, conf.high 
Type:  link 
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
out <- bootstrap_ate(lr2, college, type = "link")
c("estimate" = mean(out), "std. error" = sd(out))
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
  estimate std. error 
 0.4562075  0.1522344 
```


:::
:::
